ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The syllabus is wonderful and will provide a good grounding in thematerials of the Reformation and various methodological stances from which to approach it. Most of you learning, however, will take place on your own, as the meetings of the seminar are inefficiently run by other students who lack a framework for saying anything meaningful about the material.The Professor is very knowledgeable and easily accessible via email and for meetings. He can provide great help, but you have to take the time to do this outside of class.
I would certainly recommend this course to another student. It managed to thread the needle between broadness and specificity, and allowed students to follow their own interests.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course helped me create a broad map of the subject field and gave me a good sense of the list I would like to make for orals and questions I would like to address in my dissertation.
